Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Piss \Piss\ (p[i^]s), v. t. & i. [OE. pissen, F. pisser; akin to It. pisciare, D. & G. pissen, Dan. pisse, Icel. pissa.] To discharge urine, to urinate; -- usually considered vulgar. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Piss \Piss\, n. Urine. [vulgar] [1913 Webster]
{take a piss} urinate. [vulgar] [PJC]

piss n 1: liquid excretory product; "there was blood in his urine"; "the child had to make water" [syn: {urine}, {pee}, {piddle}, {weewee}, {water}] 2: informal terms for urination; "he took a pee" [syn: {peeing}, {pee}, {pissing}] v : eliminate urine; "Again, the cat had made on the expensive rug" [syn: {make}, {urinate}, {piddle}, {puddle}, {micturate}, {pee}, {pee-pee}, {make water}, {relieve oneself}, {take a leak}, {spend a penny}, {wee}, {wee-wee}, {pass water}]
